name: Wolf
interestingFacts: Wolves are highly social animals that live and hunt in packs.
Wolves have a strong sense of smell and hearing, which helps them locate prey.
Wolves have a wide range of vocalizations, including howls, growls, and barks.
Wolves play a vital role in maintaining the health of ecosystems by controlling prey populations.
Wolves have a hierarchical pack structure with an alpha pair as the leaders.
Wolves are excellent runners and can maintain speeds of 40 mph (65 km/h) over short distances.
Wolves have a complex body language and use facial expressions, body postures, and vocalizations to communicate within their pack.
